intro: Euphrasia tatarica, commonly known as Tatarian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent dark veins. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a hairy surface, and it produces numerous tiny flowers in clusters. Euphrasia tatarica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
